content:
https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/tests/running.html?highlight=%5Bmigrate%5D#running-tests-with-different-compare-modes
I found this which describes compare modes but I dont know what nll and migrate actually change.
specifying revisions makes sense to me.
But nll is always on anyway isnt it?
And I have no clue what migrate is referring to.

it seems that:

  • real nll was never fully enabled and that is enabled via [nll]
  • the pseudo nll that is used by default is named [migrate]
